queries.description: Omission of type specifiers may not be supported by some compilers. Additionally implicit typing can lead to undefined behaviour.
queries.name: A function shall not be declared implicitly

RULE-17-3.title: A function shall not be declared implicitly

queries.description: Using non-unique identifiers can lead to developer confusion.
queries.name: Identifiers that define objects or functions with external linkage shall be unique

RULE-5-8.title: Identifiers that define objects or functions with external linkage shall be unique

queries.description: Using non-unique identifiers can lead to developer confusion.
queries.name: Identifiers that define objects or functions with internal linkage should be unique

RULE-5-9.title: Identifiers that define objects or functions with internal linkage should be unique

queries.description: Declaring an array without an explicit size disallows the compiler and static checkers from doing array bounds analysis and can lead to less readable, unsafe code.
queries.name: When an array with external linkage is declared, its size should be explicitly specified

RULE-8-11.title: When an array with external linkage is declared, its size should be explicitly specified
